Cirque du Soleil

Case Study
Annual Bilingual Report
Theme: Illumination
Technique: pencil crayon, acrylics, desktop publishing

This is a fourteen page annual bilingual (French and English) publication that Cirque Du Soleil distributes. The school challenge was to come up with illustrations that would demonstrate the Illumination theme. The stained glass acrobats perfectly reflect this objective. It also gives the publication an unusual twist that captivates the reader and encourages readership of a report that is filled with lots of data.

History of Quotations

Case Study
Book Cover
Theme: Christmas
Technique: Illustrator, PhotoShop, InDesign

This book cover entitled: History in Quotations: Reflecting 5000 Years of World History by M.J. Cohen and John Major is designed to appeal to consumers for impulse gift giving at Christmas. To achieve this, the cover is designed as a special collector’s item. The choice of rich colours and combination of fonts in various weights and sizes, reemphasizes the special Christmas theme and helps to evoke a sense of an urgency response in shoppers.

Tic Tak Teas

Case Study
Packaging, Logo
Theme: Gourmet Teas
Technique: Illustrator, InDesign, Illustrations (marker rendering)

This packaging is designed for a tea company. It is intended to appeal to the gourmet niche market of teas. The choice of warm golds and reds would easily stand out on a crowded shelf.

Taste of Winterlude

Case Study
Bilingual Brochure and Wordmark
Theme: Winter
Media: Illustrator, InDesign

This seven page spread had some design limitations to it. I worked within those constraints to deliver a strong creative and unique wordmark. The chef is created solely out of the Kievit font. It was a fun project to work on.
